parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and lambano; to receive near, i.e. Associate with oneself; by analogy, to assume an office; figuratively, to learn.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
Peter, a Greek name meaning rock. Apparently a primary word; a rock; as a name, Petrus, an apostle.
The same as Iakob Graecized; Jacobus, the name of three Israelites.
Of Hebrew origin; Joannes, the name of four Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To begin. Middle voice of archo; to commence.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To be greatly astonished, be awe-struck. From ekthambos; to astonish utterly.
To feel fear, lack courage, be distressed, troubled. From a derivative of adeo; to be in distress.
